wikipedia_page.main: Buki Akib is a British actress. Trained at the Italia Conti Academy of Theatre Arts, she portrayed Josie Jump in the television children’s programme on  Balamory from August 2002 until September 2004, when she was replaced by Kasia Haddad.

response: * Josie Jump (played by Buki Akib in series 1 & 2, and Kasia Haddad in series 3 & 4), a fitness instructor at the primary school next door to Miss Hoolie's nursery school. She plays and coaches all types of gymnastics, sports, and dance and is also talented at storytelling through expressive movement and dance. Her main colour is yellow and she lives in a yellow towered house.

Actors Buki Akib, Jamie Campbell Bower, Arthur Brough, Tamsin Egerton, Ellis Jones, Alex Lawther and Miranda Hart were all born or live in Petersfield, as are  the BBC Radio 4's soap opera The Archers actors Charles Collingwood (Brian Aldridge) and Edward Kelsey (Joe Grundy). Sir Alec Guinness and his wife are buried in Petersfield. In the music world, tenor Wilfred Brown, Sir William Henry Harris  and composer Michael John Hurd have connections to the town; Mark Owen of Take That lives in Petersfield.
Kasia Haddad replaces Buki Akib for taking the role of Josie Jump.
Kasia Haddad is a British actress. She portrayed Josie Jump in the children's television programme Balamory (replacing Buki Akib) and Wendy in Doctors.
